topic.title: HPE Helion OpenStack 1.1: Monitoring Disk Drives in Object Storage Using hpssacli Utility

body.p: HPE Helion Object Storage (Swift) provides native monitoring of Swift services and hardware resources like disk drives.To monitor the health status of the disk drives of the Swift cluster, monitoring scripts are introduced for HPE hardware. The monitoring solution depends on hpssacli application to fetch various details of hardware to determine its health and publish to Icinga. hpssacli utility does not get installed implicitly as part of Swift node deployment.
You are advised to download and install utility as per procedure mentioned below. If utility is not installed then Icinga dashboard will reflect the various disk parameters as critical.

section.title: HPE Smart Storage Administrator CLI 2.0.22.0 (HPSSACLI)
section.p: The HPE Smart Storage Administrator CLI (HPSSACLI) is a command line disk configuration program for Smart Array Controllers.
The hpssacli utility is deployed onto the servers wherever the disks are to be monitored, usually all Object Storage(Swift), VSA, and Compute nodes.
This page explains the downloading and installation of hpssacli utility.

li.xref: Download the hpssacli debian package in the KVM host

section.title: Download the hpssacli debian package in the KVM host
Copy debian package to seed and to the Swift nodes where the disks has to be monitored
section.p: Use scp to copy the utility package on to the Swift node(s) and install it.

ol.li: Copy the package from KVM host to seed.scp "hpssacli-2.0-16.0_amd64.deb" root@<IP address of seed>
Copy the package from seed to Swift node(s) where the disks are to be monitored.scp "hpssacli-2.0-16.0_amd64.deb" heat-admin@<IP address of Swift node(s)>

p.note: Repeat this process for all the Swift nodes.

section.title: Install debian package to the Swift nodes

ol.li: Log in to the Swift node(s) where the debian is copied.ssh heat-admin@<IP address of Swift node(s)>

p.note: Repeat this process for all the Swift nodes.

section.p: The hpssacli program is now installed. Refer the following section for the collection of the diagnostic report.
This utility is used to monitor the usage of Object Storage(Swift) disk drive(s).
Once the hpssacli package is installed, Swift monitoring (ICINGA) scripts monitor the drives.
(Optional) You can also manually collect the diagnostic reports from disks in the servers as explained in the following sections.

section.title: Manual procedure to collect the diagnostic report
section.p: Perform the following steps to manually collect the diagnostic report.

ol.li:
Enter the following command to determine the controller slot.sudo hpssacli ctrl all show status
The following sample displays slot details:Smart Array P420i in Slot 0 (Embedded)
Controller Status: OK
Cache Status: OK
Battery/Capacitor Status: OK

Generate the diagnostic report for a particular slot.sudo hpssacli ctrl slot=(slot number) diag file=<filename.zip>
Or
Generate the report for all the slotssudo hpssacli ctrl all diag file=<filename.zip>
The file will be stored in the selected location.
Copy the generated file to the desired location.
Generate the diagnostic report of the particular slot. ssh heat-admin@<Machine IP address> "sudo hpssacli ctrl slot=<slot number> diag file=details_slot_<slot number>.zip"
Copy the report from the server to seed VM.scp heat-admin@<Machine IP address>:/home/heat-admin/<filename.zip>
Copy the report <filename.zip> to the KVM_hostscp details_slot_<slot number>.zip ubuntu@<KVM_Host IP address>:
Open the ADUReport.htm file in the browser. The html page displays complete details of the controller and the health status of the physical disks available in the machine.

Generate SmartSSD Wear Gauge Report from either the local server or from the seed:
From the local server
hpssacli ctrl slot=<slot number> diag file=<filename.zip> ssdrpt=on
From the seed
ssh heat-admin@<machine IP address> "sudo hpssacli ctrl slot=<slot number> diag file=<filename.zip>

li.p: To get the details of the physical disks and also the logical group status on the server

codeblock.codeph: ssh heat-admin@<machine IP address> "sudo hpssacli ctrl slot=<slot number> show config detail"

li.p: To execute other operations on physical drives

codeblock.codeph: ssh heat-admin@<machine IP address> "sudo hpssacli help physicaldrive"

li.p: Open the help to explore other options with the utility

codeblock.codeph: ssh heat-admin@<machine IP address> "sudo hpssacli help"
